intro: Mesembryanthemum fulviceps, commonly known as the yellow-nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often blooming in the evening. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. The species is also known for its ability to store water in its fleshy leaves, making it resilient to drought.
